txt.en: 'Look!'
'Still he comes! This way, [placeholder], and hurry!'
'I cannot look away. Such ferocity!'
'We must not tarry. [placeholder], this way!'
'Corudan! Where is Nona?'
'Look! It is Nona! But she is right in Núrzum's path!'
'We have to do something!'
'Follow me closely, friends! Hurry!'
'Does our luck hold?'
'Oh no... he has seen something!'
'We made it! Now we need to come up with some way to attract Núrzum's attention before he sees Nona...'
'I do not know what to do, [placeholder]! We cannot leave her! I refuse to leave Byre Tor without Nona!'
'Aldstan! I have come for you!'

'The wind is picking up, [placeholder]. Do you feel it?'

Horn looks about with concern.

'I think we may have found what we sought, my friend! Stay by me, and get ready to run if we must!'
'Aldstan! You cannot hide from me!'

'It is one thing to hear of Núrzum's great size and strength, but it is entirely different to see it for yourself! How can we hope to fight such a creature?\n\n'Woe be to Aldstan, if Núrzum finds him!'
'Aldstan! I will destroy your city!'

'We cannot keep like this for long, [placeholder]. Núrzum may not be looking for us, but if he happens upon the two of us while searching for Aldstan, he will not show mercy. That much I know for certain!\n\n'And what if he happens upon Nona and Corudan? We cannot stay here. We have to find them and leave the city!'
Horn has been defeated!
'You are a coward, Aldstan! Come face me!'

'We cannot do anything from here, [placeholder]! Perhaps if we could get to the other side of the courtyard...'

Horn's eyes are alight with the desperation of fear.

'We might be able to run behind Núrzum while his back is turned! From the far side of the courtyard we can get his attention, and draw him away from Nona!'
Corudan has been defeated!
'What is this? A tiny warrior?'

'It was not difficult to escape the giant, [placeholder]. He is big and I am small. He is slow and I am fast. He is an unnatural thing, given to evil, and I am the sister of Wadu, the daughter of Suvulch. He is alone and I have friends who care for me.

'This Núrzum was o'ermatched before he even came to Byre Tor today. I was never frightened of him.

'Still, I am glad we are safe. We should leave this place before he realizes we have gone. And [placeholder], thank you for watching out for Horn, today and for the last several days. It eased the worry of my heart to know you were by his side.'
You have been spotted by Núrzum!

'What a relief it is to see Nona safe again! Núrzum will answer to me for threatening her!\n\n'Another day, perhaps. Now we should return to Nona's cave and puzzle over the meaning of why Núrzum seeks this man Aldstan.'

'Byre Tor looks much as it did when last we were here. We have been fortunate to run into fewer Orcs than before, but remain alert, for they still hold this city.\n\n'I have seen nothing yet that might reveal Núrzum's interest in Byre Tor.'
You have come to Byre Tor with your companions to see what you can learn of Núrzum's seeming interest in the city.
'This way, my friends! Look for any sign of what drew Núrzum to this city first.'
'[placeholder], I will go with Nona to search the other side of the town.'
'Is everyone safe?'
Fight alongside Corudan in Byre Tor
'I suppose that leaves the two of us, [placeholder].'
Stay close to Horn and survive your encounter with Núrzum
'Let us search in the direction of the far gate for some sign of Núrzum's purpose.'
Follow Horn as closely as you can!
'Is it getting colder?'
Talk to Horn in Byre Tor
'Aldstan? The giant seeks a man? For what purpose?'
Talk to Horn in Byre Tor
'By the House of Eorl!'
Stay close to Horn and survive your encounter with Núrzum
'This way, [placeholder], quickly and quietly.'
'There are more Orcs ahead. They make no effort to mask their presence.'
Wait with Horn until he decides to leave
'I do not know what you mean, Corudan. Elf-talk remains a puzzle.'
Reassure Horn that all will be well
Talk to Horn in Byre Tor
'Have we been so long apart that you have forgotten?'
Talk to Nona in Byre Tor
Explore Byre Tor with Horn
'It will take more than that creature to best Nona of the Uch-lûth!'
Talk to Horn in Byre Tor
'...but I am sorry I worried you.'
Stay close to Horn and survive your encounter with Núrzum
Talk to Horn in Byre Tor
Stay close to Horn and survive your encounter with Núrzum
Keep close to Horn!
Talk to Horn in Byre Tor
'I think I will go with Nona, and you will go with [placeholder], Horn.'
Talk to Corudan in Byre Tor
'We need you to stay focused!'
'Defeat these Orcs quickly! If Núrzum sees us all is lost!'
'Well-fought, my friends! Now let us hurry!'
'Horn!'
'Horn! [placeholder]! We must flee! Follow me!'
You have come with Horn, Corudan, and Nona to the city of Byre Tor.
You have come with Horn to the eastern gate of Byre Tor, and the cold winds begin to rise.
Núrzum has returned to Byre Tor! Stay close to Horn, and out of the sight of the giant!
Horn is hiding behind a barricade in Byre Tor, as Núrzum encroaches upon his position.
Stay close to Horn! Núrzum is moving through the streets of Byre Tor and you must not lose track of your companion!
Horn has retreated to the stables of Byre Tor, while Núrzum continues his destructive march through the city.
You and Horn have found Corudan in Byre Tor, but the Elf and the Dunlending were separated by attacking Orcs and now Nona is missing.
Corudan became separated from Nona when Orcs attacked, and now she is by herself somewhere in Byre Tor, with Núrzum stalking through the streets.
Horn is by the side of a building in Byre Tor. He is desperate to think of some way to keep Núrzum from finding Nona.

'Nona and I were driven apart by attacking Orcs, and I have not seen her since. She must still be in the city. We will find her again!\n\n'That great shaking can only be Núrzum! We must not let him see us. If we do not dispose of these Orcs quickly he is sure to find us!'
'Nona!'
'Is there nothing we can do? I have to go back! This is not right!'
'The two of you may leave if you must. But I am going back for her!'
Horn is by the stables in Byre Tor, trying to come up with a way to keep Núrzum from finding Nona.
'Even if it means my life!'
Nona is in danger, but you can do nothing without putting the rest of you at risk! You must stay close to Horn and Corudan!
'Nona!'
You have escaped the centre of Byre Tor, but Nona is still in danger! Horn is at a loss, and does not know what he can do to help her.
Nona has given Núrzum the slip, much to your relief and that of your companions... especially Horn.
Instance: Núrzum
